text: The <extra_id_0> retinoblastoma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene product ( <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is a nuclear phosphoprotein that regulates cell cycle progression .
<extra_id_0> Elf-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a lymphoid - specific Ets transcription factor that regulates inducible gene expression during T cell activation .

text: These results demonstrate that <extra_id_0> Rb <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> interacts specifically with a lineage - restricted Ets transcription factor .
This regulated interaction may be important for the coordination of lineage - specific effector functions such as lymphokine production with cell cycle progression in activated T cells .
